Package org.bonitasoft.engine.operation

Class OperationBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.bonitasoft.engine.operation.OperationBuilder
public class OperationBuilder extends Object
Utilitary builder to creation Operation objects. Operations are a way to 'assign', 'operate', 'set a new value', ... on something. See OperatorType for the different types of operation.
Author:
Zhang Bole, Baptiste Mesta, Emmanuel Duchastenier, Matthieu Chaffotte
See Also:
  • OperatorType
  • Operation

  • Method Details

    • createNewInstance

      public OperationBuilder createNewInstance()
      Initiate the building of a new Operation. The Operation building will be complete when calling the done() method.
      Returns:
      this builder itself, so that calls the various exposed methods can be chained.

    • setLeftOperand

      public OperationBuilder setLeftOperand(LeftOperand leftOperand)
      Sets the LeftOperand of this operation. A LeftOperand can be obtained by using LeftOperandBuilder.
      Parameters:
      leftOperand - the LeftOperand to set.
      Returns:
      this builder itself, so that calls the various exposed methods can be chained.
      See Also:
      • LeftOperandBuilder

    • setLeftOperand

      public OperationBuilder setLeftOperand(String name, String type)
      Sets the LeftOperand of this operation. It is built for you with its name and external properties.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the left operand
      type -
      Returns:
      this builder itself, so that calls the various exposed methods can be chained.

    • createSetDataOperation

      public Operation createSetDataOperation(String dataName, Expression expression)
      Parameters:
      dataName -
      expression -
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • createBusinessDataSetAttributeOperation

      public Operation createBusinessDataSetAttributeOperation(String businessDataName, String methodName, String methodParamType, Expression expression)
      Creates a new operation of type LeftOperand.TYPE_BUSINESS_DATA that allows to update a Business Data by calling a Java setter on one of its attributes.
      Parameters:
      businessDataName - the name of the business data to update.
      methodName - the Java setter method to call.
      methodParamType - the type of the Java setter method parameter (to be able to differentiate 2 methods with the same name but with different parameter types)
      expression - the Expression to evaluate that represents the new value to set.
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • attachBusinessDataSetAttributeOperation

      public Operation attachBusinessDataSetAttributeOperation(String businessDataName, Expression expressionReturningBusinessData)
      Creates a new operation of type OperatorType.ASSIGNMENT that associates an existing Business Data to the current process.
      Parameters:
      businessDataName - the name of the reference in the process.
      expressionReturningBusinessData - the expression returning an existing business data.
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.
      See Also:
      • LeftOperand.TYPE_BUSINESS_DATA

    • deleteBusinessDataOperation

      public Operation deleteBusinessDataOperation(String businessDataName)
      Creates a new operation of type OperatorType.ASSIGNMENT that remove the named Business Data of the current process.
      Parameters:
      businessDataName - the name of the reference in the process.
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.
      See Also:
      • OperatorType.DELETION

    • createSetDocument

      public Operation createSetDocument(String docName, Expression expression)
      create an operation that update a document
      Parameters:
      docName - the name of the document
      expression - the expression that returns a org.bonitasoft.engine.bpm.document.DocumentValue
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • createSetDocumentList

      public Operation createSetDocumentList(String docName, Expression expression)
      create an operation that update a document list
      Parameters:
      docName - the name of the document list
      expression - the expression that returns a list of org.bonitasoft.engine.bpm.document.DocumentValue
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • createXPathOperation

      public Operation createXPathOperation(String xmlName, String xPath, Expression setValue)
      create an operation that update an xml data using a xpath expression
      Parameters:
      xmlName - name of the data
      xPath - the xpath expression
      setValue - the value to set the node in the data with
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • createJavaMethodOperation

      public Operation createJavaMethodOperation(String objectName, String methodName, String methodParamType, Expression methodParams)
      create an operation that update a data that contains a java object
      Parameters:
      objectName - the name of the data
      methodName - the method to call on this data to update it
      methodParamType - the type of the parameter of the method
      methodParams - the value to call the method with
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • createSetStringIndexOperation

      public Operation createSetStringIndexOperation(int index, Expression setValue)
      Creates a new operation that sets a new value to a String search key, also known as string index.
      Parameters:
      index - the search key to set
      setValue - the Expression to set the search key to.
      Returns:
      the newly created Operation.

    • done

      public Operation done()
      Returns:
      the newly built Operation.

    • getNonNullCopy

      public static Operation getNonNullCopy(Operation operation)
      Get a copy of this operation, so that this operation can be added at several places without conflicting because of unique ID constraint. If operation is null, simply returns null. In particular, the right operand expression needs to be unique, because of its ID.
      Parameters:
      operation - the operation to copy
      Returns:
      a deep copy of this operation, or null.
